page.title: 18Traffic counts in Stoke
page.content: On 24th. May 1985 we went to make traffic counts on 5 roads in our area. We chose a dual carriageway and 4 main roads.We counted for 15 minutes. The A500 was very busy.In 15 minutes 540 cars,179 lorries and vans,5 buses and coaches and 16 bikes passed by.The road was so busy it was hard to keep the count! Of the other 4 roads London Road was the busiest with 130 cars,22 lorries and vans,2 buses and coaches and 12 bikes.London Road is so busy because it links Stoke with Trent Vale and Hanford.It is also a main bus route. There are a number of danger spots along the road,so there are 2 sets of pelican crossings and a zebra crossing. The quietest road was Trent Valley Road.Only 36 vehicles passed during the 15 minutes.
